byline.original: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE and MICHAEL R. GORDON

abstract: United Nations report finds Russian influx of troops and heavy weaponry is intensifying Ukrainian-Russian conflict and increasing casualties with 6000 having died since April 2014 start of war; notes at least 842 people died from mid-January 2015 to mid-February; United States and Russia meet to discuss possible consequences of reported cease-fire violations by Russia.
lead_paragraph: A report cites an influx of Russian troops and weapons as undermining chances for peace in a conflict that has left more than 6,000 dead since April.

headline.main: Fighting in Ukraine Has Killed More Than 840 Since Mid-January, U.N. Says
headline.print_headline: Ukraine: U.N. Details Fighting’s Toll as U.S. and Russian Officials Meet

snippet: A report cites an influx of Russian troops and weapons as undermining chances for peace in a conflict that has left more than 6,000 dead since April.
